thread.title: Abortion clinics make plea to Supreme Court to strike Texas law
thread.title_full: Abortion clinics make plea to Supreme Court to strike Texas law

author: sferris@thehill.com (Sarah Ferris)
title: Abortion clinics make plea to Supreme Court to strike Texas law
text:
Abortion clinics make plea to Supreme Court to strike Texas law By Sarah Ferris - 09/03/15 11:39 AM EDT Abortion rights groups are urging the Supreme Court to step in and overturn a restrictive Texas law, which they call the most extreme in the country. “We’re counting on the Supreme Court to hear our call for justice,” Amy Hagstrom Miller, the president of a Texas-based clinic called Whole Woman’s Health, told reporters on Thursday. ADVERTISEMENT “Women and families are confused as to what their rights are,” she added, pointing to the direct consequences her clinic and others have felt from the law. The legislation passed in 2013 to much fanfare after then-state Sen. Wendy Davis staged a 13-hour filibuster against it. The high-court effort comes after two years of appeals in Texas — a battle that has been fought by national groups like Center for Reproductive Rights and Planned Parenthood. 
“It’s time for the Supreme Court to step in,” Nancy Northup, president of the Center for Reproductive Rights, told reporters on Thursday. She stressed that the stakes for the decision are high and warned that if the law is allowed to stand, copycat laws “will proliferate.” The case against Texas’s law comes amid scores of lawsuits across the country, including another case from the Center for Reproductive Rights involves admitting privileges in Mississippi. The Supreme Court punted on that case during its last session, and it will now await the justices this fall. 
The state of Texas has 30 days to respond. The Supreme Court will likely make the decision whether to take up the case before November. 
If it does take up the case, a decision on abortion would catapult the issue into the 2016 presidential election, where the fallout from undercover Planned Parenthood videos is still making waves.
